text: Trading the wheel for income. We just had a great conversation about that on a live stream. You should check them out We stream daily, but I want to walk you through an actual practical example of this and why there is some really important nuances You have to be aware of if you think you're going to trade the wheel for income, especially in some index spy Now one of the big issues people have with the wheel is it sounds so good It sounds like a win-win-win-win, right? You so cash secured puts you get assigned at a cheaper basis You collect premium to do it you sell calls collect premium against the shares that you hold and then you hold shares that appreciate and value It sounds great across the board and I am actually an advocate of a very close cousin to the wheel that I think is far superior Which is a covered strangle some slight nuances between them I'll throw a link in the notes below that walk through that strategy and why I really prefer it over the wheel But they're not that far apart Now the main thing is when we approach trading we have to approach it with our eyes wide open That means we can't focus just on the elements that sound good or the pieces that we like We have to walk through the reality of what it can look like In general the markets look good the exhibit

text: this right so like The last couple short calls that we traded We made 26 on those And we just Don't have a lot To show for the risk that we're putting out And I think what did we get on these up here Yeah the 26 bucks So Here's a couple things to keep in mind If we're trading the wheel for income The first thing that you can do is the biggest favor to yourself Is don't use the income for the same month or even the same year My advice is if you're trading for income Essentially pad at least one full year of your required income That's padded meaning you give it a buffer So that this way as we're going through a negative period like this We can stomach it The fact that we're only taking 26 in Wouldn't be sufficient for income But if I'm able to trade other things At the same time I'm doing this to take advantage of the current And then eventually this recovers and start to show a profit That compensates for the loss Then that pluses back up where I need to be For my 12 month buffer of income I actually would do no less than 24 months Two years personally So the market can have Pro long down periods And this is one of them If we continue this exercise It's the same thing for the next six months You're just not able to collect much
